newsitem.title: USA: Unocal reports offshore Indonesia wells.
newsitem.headline: Unocal reports offshore Indonesia wells.

text.p: Unocal Corp said Monday its Indonesian subsidiary had drilled seven successful oil and gas exploration wells in the Mahakam Delta area offshore East Kalimantan in Indonesia.

"Based on the drilling to date, we currently estimate that these discoveries contain more than 40 million barrels of oil equivalent (BOE) of recoverable oil and gas with a finding costs of about 50 cents per BOE," said Charles Williamson, Unocal group vice presidnet for international operations.
It said four of the drilling successes came in the first phase of the company's "saturation-exploration" (S-X) program.
Williamson noted that a typical S-X well costs about $1 million and takes under 10 days to complete, compared wtih $4.3 million and more than 50 days for a conventional well.
Unocal expects to drill 20 S-X wells this year, the first phase of a three-year, 60-well program.
